DOC.brief_summary: This prospective cohort study investigate cardiac function cardiac biomarkers patient acute Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Haemorrhage ( aSAH ) . The aim study document incidence myocardial dysfunction , find predictive factor myocardial dysfunction , describe heart rate variability ass impact cardiac problem morbidity mortality .
DOC.brief_title: Cardiopulmonary Complication Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Haemorrhage Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Laboratory marker daily : Routine laboratory test ( blood gas , haemoglobin , thrombocyte , leukocyte , INR , bilirubin , creatinine , c-reactive protein , CK , CK-MB , Tnt , BNP , sodium , potassium , magnesium ) take 8 a.m. Study laboratory test ( sensitive ischemia marker , remodelling marker MMP-9 CgA surrogate marker increase sympathetic activity ) take four time study period time cardiac ECHOes Holtering . Gene sample take day one . Primary outcome measurement document incidence myocardial dysfunction predictive factor hospital stay three month . Secondary outcome assess impact cardiac problem morbidity mortality first three month .
DOC.criteria: Patients nontraumatic subarachnoid haemorrhage Age > 18 year Aneurysmal bleed No consent Age < 18 year Anticipated brain death < 24 hour Otherwise moribund patient
